intro: Eritrichium albiflorum, commonly known as the white sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its hairy stems and showy flowers. Eritrichium albiflorum is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to dry conditions.
